intro: Meionandra, commonly known as the common meionandra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in spring. Meionandra is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
